div.l: And sith I shal haue none amendement
Ageyn̄ my losse I wille haue esement
By cokkis soule it shal none othir be
Þis Iohn ansuerd aleyn̄ avise thee
Þis mylner is a p̉erilous man̄ he seid
And if he out of his slepe breide
He might do us bothe a villany
Aleyn ansuerd I count him not a flye
Vp he risith and bi þe wench he crept
Þis wenche lay upright ⁊and fast she slept
Til he so nye was or she might aspie
That it had ben̄ to late forto crye
And shortly forto sey þei wer͗e atton̄
Now pley aleyn̄ for I wil speke of Ion
¶This Iohn lith stille a furlong wey or two
And to himselue he makith ruthe and wo
Alas qᵈuod he this is a wicked Iape
Now may I sey that I is but an ape
Yit has my felau sumwhat for his harm̄
He has the mylner doughtir in his arme
He auntird him and has his nedis spedde
And I ligge as a draffe secke in my bedde
And whan̄ this laike is telled anoþir day
I mon̄ be holden̄ a daffid Cokenay
I wil ryse and auntir me be my faith
Vnhardy vncely thus men̄ saythe
And up he roos and furth he went
Vnto the cradil ⁊and in his armes it hent
And bare it soft vnto his beddis fete
And sone aftir the wif hir routyng lete
And gan̄ to wake and went hir vnto pisse
And cam̄ agein and gan̄ hir cradil mysse
And gropid hyer͗e but ther͗e she founde none
Alas qᵈuod she I hadde almost mysgone
I had almost gon̄ to the Clerkis bedde
Ey benedicite than̄ hadde I foul spedde
And furþ she goth til she the cradil fon
